授業方法: Full Online simultaneous and two-way format throughout the course. Lectures, assigned group projects, and case discussions in class are planned.

第1回:
Introduction and Course Overview
Marketing Mix; The role of the elements of the promotional mix; how advertising relates to them
第2回: Integrated Marketing Communications (IMC) 1 - a newer approach for success in Marketing Communications
第3回: Integrated Marketing Communications (IMC) 2- ; How Advertising links to IMC?  Changing Environment for Brands and their efforts toward IMC
第4回: Planning advertising strategy; Planning process of strategy and tactics
第5回: Creative strategy: How marketing practitioners can deliver consumer insights and help developing message with creative teams
第7回: Media Strategy: The characteristics and roles of traditional media-TV Radio, Newspaper, Magazine
第8回: Managing emerging media- Digital and social media; Criteria used to select among them-Media selection now and then; Media development in practice
第9回: Budget allocation and Evaluation Process for Marketing Communication: measuring the impact of advertising campaign-qualitative vs. quantitative; the research process to evaluate findings
第10回: Sales Promotions in the context of IMC: Defining Sales Promotion; Strengths and Weaknesses of Sales Promotion; Planning; Sales Promotion Campaign Analysis
第11回: Public Relations as a vital tool for IMC; new perspective of marketing communication-“MPR”
第13回: Communicating in the Global Environment --Effective Marketing Communication in the Age of  Branding
第14回: Wrap up-- Expanding the Marketing Horizon: Social Marketing and the challenges ahead
トピック.授業外学習2:
Students are expected to fully prepare for each session through completion of reading assignments, cases, participation of discussion topics, and peer learning experiences as instructed via LUNA and/or in-class announcements.
There will be a mix of theory and practice through utilizing real-work examples. Students are expected to demonstrate one’s ideas and insights through interactive class participation, work with peers, and assignments. Therefore, it is strongly suggested for the student to have completed Marketing Management and Marketing Research before taking this course.
